[INST] What wall officially came down in 1989, symbolizing the end of the Cold War? [/INST]

The Berlin Wall, which had divided the city of Berlin, Germany, and the surrounding area since 1961, officially came down in 1989, marking the end of the Cold War. This event was significant as it symbolized the end of the division of Europe and the beginning of a new era of international relations.
The Berlin Wall
The Berlin Wall came down in 1989, marking the end of the Cold War and symbolizing the new era of international relations.
[INST] Which country was the first to use paper money? [/INST]

The use of paper money dates back to ancient China during the Tang Dynasty (618-907 AD). The first paper money was called 'jiaozi,' and it was used for large transactions and as a substitute for copper coins.
China
The use of paper money dates back to ancient China during the Tang Dynasty (618-907 CE). The first paper money was called "Jiaozi" and was used for large transactions.
[INST] Who was the first person to circumnavigate the globe? [/INST]

The first person to circumnavigate the globe is generally considered to be Ferdinand Magellan, a Portuguese explorer who led the first expedition to successfully circumnavigate the globe from west to east. This journey took place from 1519 to 1522.
Ferdinand Magellan
The first person to circumnavigate the globe was Ferdinand Magellan, a Portuguese explorer who led the expedition from 1519 to 1522.
[INST] Where was the ancient Library of Alexandria located? [/INST]

The ancient Library of Alexandria was located in Alexandria, Egypt. The exact location of the library is unknown, but it is believed to have been situated near the seafront, overlooking the Mediterranean.
Alexandria
The ancient Library of Alexandria was located in Alexandria, Egypt.
[INST] Who was the South African president who ended apartheid? [/INST]

The South African president who officially ended apartheid was Nelson Mandela. In 1994, Mandela, who was the first black president of South Africa, dismantled the apartheid system, paving the way for a more inclusive and democratic government.
F. W. de Klerk

Nelson Mandela was the South African president who ended apartheid in the country. He was instrumental in leading the fight against apartheid and was eventually released from prison after 27 years, going on to become the country's first black president and leading the transition to democracy.
[INST] What is the name of the first human spaceflight program by the United States? [/INST]

The first human spaceflight program by the United States was called Project Mercury. This program was initiated in 1959 and ran until 1963, with the goal of sending astronauts into space for the first time.
Mercury
The first human spaceflight program by the United States was called Project Mercury.
